com.jesus_crie.modularbot_message_decorator.decorator

Class MessageDecorator<T extends net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.Event>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jesus_crie.modularbot_message_decorator.decorator.MessageDecorator<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoDestroyMessageDecorator, ReactionDecorator

    public abstract class MessageDecorator<T extends net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.Event>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that can extends the behaviour of a discord Message by interacting in specific manners with it. Some of the methods of this class aren't required by every type of decorator so they will throw exceptions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageDecorator

        protected MessageDecorator(@Nonnull
                           net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Message binding,
                           long timeout)
        Build the base of a decorator. If the given timeout isn't valid (base on checkTimeout(long)) the decorator will call destroy() and throw an exception right after.
        Parameters:
        binding - The message to bind to this decorator.
        timeout - The amount of time before the decorator expire.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given timeout is invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • createListener

        @Nonnull
protected Waiter.WaiterListener<T> createListener(@Nonnull
                                                            java.lang.Object... args)
        Used to create the listener. By default, no listener is created and an exception is thrown instead.

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Used to setup the decorator, this must be triggered out of the constructor.

      • register

        public void register(@Nonnull
                     ModularBot bot)
        Register this decorator. You need to invoke this if you want it to be correctly handled and especially if you want it to be serialized.
        Parameters:
        bot - The current instance of ModularBot.
        See Also:
        register(MessageDecoratorModule)

      • register

        public void register(@Nonnull
                     MessageDecoratorModule module)
        Register this decorator. You need to invoke this if you want it to be correctly handled and especially if you want it to be serialized.
        Parameters:
        module - The current MessageDecoratorModule.
        See Also:
        register(ModularBot)

      • onTimeout

        protected void onTimeout()
        Triggered when the decorator times out. If this method isn't overridden, it will throw an exception but this method isn't called by default.

        On the other hand, an implementation like ReactionDecorator will call destroy() on timeout which is an expected behaviour.

      • destroy

        public abstract void destroy()
        Destroy the decorator.

        The effect of this method might depend of the implementation. Depending of the implementation this method can also be called as a result of onTimeout().

      • checkTimeout

        protected boolean checkTimeout(long timeout)
        Used to check if the given timeout is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to check.
        Returns:
        True if the timeout is valid, otherwise false.

      • getExpireTime

        public long getExpireTime()
        Get the timestamp in milliseconds where the decorator will have expired or 0 for infinite or -1 if the decorator is dead.
        Returns:
        A timestamp in milliseconds or 0.

      • getBinding

        public net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Message getBinding()
        Get the bound message.
        Returns:
        The bound message.

      • updateMessage

        protected void updateMessage()
        Update the reference to the bound message by querying it again from JDA.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Check if the decorator is still alive.
        Returns:
        True if its alive, otherwise false.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Check if 2 decorators are the same. They must be an instance of the same decorator and be bound to the same binding.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The other potentially equal decorator.
        Returns:
        True if they are equivalent.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
